CatDescriptText: Mr. Robert (Bob) Jones, 3422 Milwaukee Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 20, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the police department states more raids in Negro neighborhoods than in white areas, because there is more crime in former districts?" answer reads: "I wouldn't say that there is more crime in Negro areas, especially the Hill district, than there is in areas like Lawrenceville and Larimer Ave. In East Liberty, where Italians are pretty bad.  The reason for the raids seems..."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Robert (Bob) Jones wearing eyeglasses and moustache, holding cigarette and straw hat, standing on corner of Fifth and Liberty Avenues, Thrift Drugs and Kappels in background, Downtown
